FuncDef:
The qos user-queue resource command configures a resource size for user queues in 4-queue or enhanced 8-CoS mode on a board.
The undo qos user-queue resource command deletes a resource size configured for user queues in 4-queue or enhanced 8-CoS mode on a board.
By default, the resource size of user queues in 4-queue or enhanced 8-CoS mode is 0.
CLIs: undo qos user-queue resource 8cos-enhance <8cos-enhance-size> { inbound | outbound }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a resource size for user queues in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
The value is an integer that ranges from 4 to 7000. The value must be a multiple of 4.

Displays the statistics about the traffic policy applied to the interface in the inbound direction.
-

Displays the statistics about the traffic policy applied to the interface in the outbound direction.
-

Specifies the specification of SQs supporting the 4-CoS flow queue mode.
The value is an integer that ranges from 4 to 64000. The value must be a multiple of 4.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
User queues in different modes share resources on a board. By default, no resource size is configured for user queues in 4-queue or enhanced 8-CoS mode.
Before configuring functions related to user queues in 4-queue or enhanced 8-CoS mode, run this command to configure a resource size for these user queues.
Precautions
Only LPUF-240s and LPUF-480s support the 4-CoS mode.
Only LPUI-52/LPUF-53/LPUI-242/LPUF-243/LPUI-242-CM/LPUI-242-G/LPUI-402/LPUI-402-CM/LPUF-483/LPUI-2T-L/LPUI-2T-CM/LPUF-1T2 boards support user queues in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
